sentence: The Procter & Gamble CompanyPG announced that David Taylor, the 35-year company veteran, will replace Alan George Lafley as the company's CEO.

Taylor, the current head of global beauty, grooming and health care business, will assume responsibility as the CEO and President from Nov 1 while Lafley will become executive chairman to counsel and mentor him.
This is the second time in a little more than two years that P&G has announced a CEO change.
In 2013, the Cincinnati-based consumer products giant brought back Lafley to replace Robert McDonald as CEO to improve operations.
Lafley, who joined P&G in 1977, became the President and CEO in 2000 and continued till 2009.
McDonald served as the President and CEO from 2009 to 2013.

In order to bring the business back on track, in Aug 2014, CEO Lafley announced portfolio strengthening and simplification plans to streamline the business to focus more on its biggest brands including the Billion Dollar Brands like Tide, Pampers and Oral-B.
Under the plan, that is nearing completion, the company has eliminated almost 60% of the brands (equating to roughly 100 brands) that were witnessing decline in sales and profits.
P&G is now close to having a portfolio of about 65 consumer and shopper preferred leading brands focusing on 10 categories organized under four industry-based sectors.
As part of the plan, the Zacks Rank #3 (Hold) company entered into a deal to sell 43 beauty brands to Coty Inc. COTY in July this year.
Last year, P&G sold off its American and Asian pet care business to Mars, Inc. in July and the European pet care business to Spectrum Brands, Inc. SPB in December.
Moreover, the company has signed a deal to divest the Duracell batteries business to Berkshire Hathaway, Inc. BRK.B in exchange for Berkshire's equity stake in P&G.
In addition, the company has already exited the Bleach business, Vicks VapoStream, Camay and Zest bar soap brands, and several skin care and fragrance brands.
With the transformation almost over, P&G believes it is the right time to bring Taylor as the CEO who has been with P&G since 1980, and held responsible positions.
It remains to be seen if he can improve sales and profits at the much slimmer and more-focused P&G amid a difficult macroeconomic environment.
P&G is due to report fourth-quarter and fiscal 2015 results on July 30, before the market opens.
